items.abstract: <jats:p>In the structure of the novel zinc complex<jats:italic>catena</jats:italic>-poly[[diaqua(4-hydroxybenzohydrazide)zinc(II)]-μ-sulfato], [Zn(SO<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>)(C<jats:sub>7</jats:sub>H<jats:sub>8</jats:sub>N<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>)(H<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O)<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>]<jats:sub><jats:italic>n</jats:italic></jats:sub>, the complex cations are linked by sulfate counter-ions into helical polymeric chains extending along the<jats:italic>b</jats:italic>axis. Each helix is stabilized by six intrachain hydrogen bonds involving stronger O—H...O (1.83–2.06 Å) and weaker N—H...O (2.20–2.49 Å) interactions. The Zn<jats:sup>II</jats:sup>atom displays a distorted octahedral geometry formed by the 4-hydroxybenzohydrazide ligand, two water molecules and two SO<jats:sub>4</jats:sub><jats:sup>2−</jats:sup>ions, which is very similar to the metal-atom environment in a previously reported Co<jats:sup>II</jats:sup>complex [Zasłona, Drożdżewski & Kubiak (2010).<jats:italic>J. Mol. Struct.</jats:italic><jats:bold>982</jats:bold>, 1–8], especially the Zn—O and Zn—N bond lengths of 2.0453 (12)–2.1602 (9) and 2.1118 (12) Å, respectively.</jats:p>
title: A helical coordination polymer of zinc(II), 4-hydroxybenzohydrazide and sulfate ions

items.abstract: <jats:title>ABSTRACT</jats:title><jats:p>Alloys of the CuAlS<jats:sub>2</jats:sub> – CuFeS<jats:sub>2</jats:sub> system were prepared by thermobaric treatment at high pressure of 5.5 GPa and temperatures ranging from 573 to 1573 K and phase formation in the system was investigated using X-ray powder diffraction, optical microscopy and scanning electron microscopy equipped with energy dispersive spectroscopy. The unit-cell parameters (the lattice constants and the unit-cell volume) were computed as a function of the composition. Absence of complete solubility in the (CuAlS<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>1-x</jats:sub>-(CuFeS<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>)<jats:sub>x</jats:sub> system was established. Formation of solid solutions with the tetragonal structure of chalcopyrite was detected for compositions with the molar part of CuFeS<jats:sub>2</jats:sub> x not exceeding 0.10.</jats:p>
title: XRPD and Scanning Electron Microscopy of Alloys of the CuAlS2 – CuFeS2 System Prepared by Thermobaric Treatment
